issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I did the following:

  
% $EUCALYPTUS/usr/sbin/euca_conf -d $EUCALYPTUS --setup

  

% ls -l $EUCALYPTUS/var/lib/eucalyptus/

total 24

drwx------ 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 CC

drwx------ 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 db

drwx------ 3 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 11:33 dynserv

drwx------ 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 keys

drwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 modules

drwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 webapps

  
*** Note the correct perms on db and keys ***  
  
% $EUCALYPTUS/usr/sbin/euca_conf -d $EUCALYPTUS --enable cloud --enable walrus
--enable sc

  
*** did ls again, perms are still correct ***  
  
% $EUCALYPTUS/etc/init.d/eucalyptus-cloud start

  
*** After maybe a min ***  
% ls -l $EUCALYPTUS/var/lib/eucalyptus/

drwx------ 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 CC

drwxr-xr-x 9 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 11:34 db

drwx------ 3 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 11:33 dynserv

drwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 11:34 keys

drwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus root  4096 2011-05-31 11:34 ldap

drwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 modules

drwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus root  4096 2011-05-31 11:34 queue

-rw-r--r-- 1 root  root  2 2011-05-31 11:33 services

drwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 webapps

  
*** Note that db and keys are now world readable and executable !!! ***  
  
So, now any user on the machine has access to, for example, keys. For example,
as a user 'rusvika', I am able to get a private admin key by running:

  
openssl pkcs12 -in /opt/eucalyptus/eee-root/vika-eee-
soap/var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/euca.p12 -name eucalyptus -name "eucalyptus"
-password pass:eucalyptus  -passin pass:eucalyptus -passout pass:eucalyptus
-nodes | grep -A30 "friendlyName: eucalyptus" | grep -A26 "BEGIN RSA"

  
the command that I obtained from reading:

% less $EUCALYPTUS/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucadmin/getcredentials.py

  
What is going on with permissions? This creates a huge security hole in the
system! We need to be very careful on what, how, and when updates permissions
on various eucalyptus directories because many of our protection mechanisms
rely on correctly-set (non-permissive) permissions. Also,  *.pem and *.p12
files should not be world readable regardless of the permissions on keys dir.
fields.summary: permissions on keys and db dirs changed to world-readable at runtime after eucalyptus-cloud start

comments.body:
Originally posted on 2011-05-31 18:57:50

Tue May 31 11:57:50 2011: Request 2378 was acted upon.
 Transaction: Ticket created by vika.felmetsger
       Queue: Engineering Bugs
     Subject: permissions on keys and db dirs changed to world-readable at
 runtime after eucalyptus-cloud start
       Owner: Nobody
  Requestors: Vika.Felmetsger@eucalyptus.com
      Status: new
 Ticket <URL: http://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=2378 >


 I did the following:

% $EUCALYPTUS/usr/sbin/euca_conf -d $EUCALYPTUS --setup

% ls -l $EUCALYPTUS/var/lib/eucalyptus/total 24drwx------ 2 eucalyptus
eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 CCdrwx------ 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096
2011-05-31 09:56 dbdrwx------ 3 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 11:33
dynservdrwx------ 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 keysdrwxr-xr-x
2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 modulesdrwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus
eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 webapps
*** Note the correct perms on db and keys ***

% $EUCALYPTUS/usr/sbin/euca_conf -d $EUCALYPTUS --enable cloud --enable walrus
--enable sc

*** did ls again, perms are still correct ***

% $EUCALYPTUS/etc/init.d/eucalyptus-cloud start

*** After maybe a min ***
% ls -l $EUCALYPTUS/var/lib/eucalyptus/
drwx------ 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 CCdrwxr-xr-x 9
eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 11:34 dbdrwx------ 3 eucalyptus
eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 11:33 dynservdrwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096
2011-05-31 11:34 keysdrwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus root 4096 2011-05-31 11:34 ldapdrwxr-xr-x
2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 modulesdrwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus
root 4096 2011-05-31 11:34 queue-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 2 2011-05-31 11:33
servicesdrwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 webapps
*** Note that db and keys are now world readable and executable !!! ***

So, now any user on the machine has access to, for example, keys. For example,
as a user 'rusvika', I am able to get a private admin key by running:

openssl pkcs12 -in
/opt/eucalyptus/eee-root/vika-eee-soap/var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/euca.p12 -name
eucalyptus -name "eucalyptus" -password pass:eucalyptus -passin pass:eucalyptus
-passout pass:eucalyptus -nodes | grep -A30 "friendlyName: eucalyptus" | grep
-A26 "BEGIN RSA"

the command that I obtained from reading:
% less $EUCALYPTUS/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucadmin/getcredentials.py

What is going on with permissions? This creates a huge security hole in the
system! We need to be very careful on what, how, and when updates permissions
on various eucalyptus directories because many of our protection mechanisms
rely on correctly-set (non-permissive) permissions. Also, *.pem and *.p12 files
should not be world readable regardless of the permissions on keys dir.

Originally posted on 2011-06-01 01:41:26
in:

  
./clc/modules/msgs/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/system/SubDirectory.java

  
and

  
./clc/modules/msgs/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/system/BaseDirectory.java

  
There is an assertPermissions() that gets run over those directories that runs
chmod with +rwX.  Chris, can this line be changed to 'chmod 0700' instead of
'chmod +rwX'?

  
On Tue May 31 11:57:50 2011, vika.felmetsger wrote:

> I did the following:

>

> % $EUCALYPTUS/usr/sbin/euca_conf -d $EUCALYPTUS --setup

>

> % ls -l $EUCALYPTUS/var/lib/eucalyptus/total 24drwx------ 2 eucalyptus

> eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 CCdrwx------ 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus

> 4096

> 2011-05-31 09:56 dbdrwx------ 3 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31

> 11:33

> dynservdrwx------ 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56

> keysdrwxr-xr-x

> 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 modulesdrwxr-xr-x 2

> eucalyptus

> eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 webapps

> *** Note the correct perms on db and keys ***

>

> % $EUCALYPTUS/usr/sbin/euca_conf -d $EUCALYPTUS --enable cloud

> --enable walrus

> --enable sc

>

> *** did ls again, perms are still correct ***

>

>

> *** After maybe a min ***

> % ls -l $EUCALYPTUS/var/lib/eucalyptus/

> drwx------ 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 CCdrwxr-xr-x

> 9

> eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 11:34 dbdrwx------ 3 eucalyptus

> eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 11:33 dynservdrwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus

> eucalyptus 4096

> 2011-05-31 11:34 keysdrwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus root 4096 2011-05-31

> 11:34 ldapdrwxr-xr-x

> 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56 modulesdrwxr-xr-x 2

> eucalyptus

> root 4096 2011-05-31 11:34 queue-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 2 2011-05-31

> 11:33

> servicesdrwxr-xr-x 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus 4096 2011-05-31 09:56

> webapps

> *** Note that db and keys are now world readable and executable !!!

> ***

>

> So, now any user on the machine has access to, for example, keys. For

> example,

> as a user 'rusvika', I am able to get a private admin key by running:

>

> openssl pkcs12 -in

> /opt/eucalyptus/eee-root/vika-eee-

> soap/var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/euca.p12 -name

> eucalyptus -name "eucalyptus" -password pass:eucalyptus -passin

> pass:eucalyptus

> -passout pass:eucalyptus -nodes | grep -A30 "friendlyName: eucalyptus"

> | grep

> -A26 "BEGIN RSA"

>

> the command that I obtained from reading:

> % less $EUCALYPTUS/usr/lib/python2.6/site-

> packages/eucadmin/getcredentials.py

>

> What is going on with permissions? This creates a huge security hole

> in the

> system! We need to be very careful on what, how, and when updates

> permissions

> on various eucalyptus directories because many of our protection

> mechanisms

> rely on correctly-set (non-permissive) permissions. Also, *.pem and

> *.p12 files

> should not be world readable regardless of the permissions on keys

> dir.

Originally posted on 2011-06-01 01:41:27

<URL: http://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=2378 >

in:

./clc/modules/msgs/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/system/SubDirectory.java

and

./clc/modules/msgs/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/system/BaseDirectory.java

There is an assertPermissions() that gets run over those directories that runs
chmod with +rwX. Chris, can this line be changed to 'chmod 0700' instead of
'chmod +rwX'?
